name: Leviathan
blurb: Sea-dragon of terrifying ferocity—no human can leash him; God alone plays with Leviathan. Evil’s chaos is not ultimate.
searchText: leviathan entity theology sea-dragon of terrifying ferocity—no human can leash him; god alone plays with leviathan. evil’s chaos is not ultimate.

name: Chaldean raiding bands
blurb: Northern/mesopotamian raiders in three companies who carry off camels—international reach of Job’s testing.
searchText: chaldean raiding bands group narrative northern/mesopotamian raiders in three companies who carry off camels—international reach of job’s testing.

name: Job’s daughters: Jemimah, Keziah, Keren-happuch
blurb: Named for beauty and blessing—inheritance granted with their brothers, subverting norms; Keren-happuch (‘horn of eye-shadow’) hints at adornment and dignity.
searchText: job’s daughters: jemimah, keziah, keren-happuch group narrative named for beauty and blessing—inheritance granted with their brothers, subverting norms; keren-happuch (‘horn of eye-shadow’) hints at adornment and dignity.

name: Job’s sons (after restoration)
blurb: Seven sons—number of completeness resumes; the text preserves daughters’ names as a theological signal.
searchText: job’s sons (after restoration) group record seven sons—number of completeness resumes; the text preserves daughters’ names as a theological signal.

name: Relatives and acquaintances who had known him before
blurb: They eat with him, comfort him, and each gives a piece of silver and a ring of gold—community repairs the social fabric of suffering.
searchText: relatives and acquaintances who had known him before group narrative they eat with him, comfort him, and each gives a piece of silver and a ring of gold—community repairs the social fabric of suffering.

name: Sabean raiders
blurb: Southern marauders who seize oxen and donkeys and kill servants—first human blow in Job’s cascade of loss.
searchText: sabean raiders group narrative southern marauders who seize oxen and donkeys and kill servants—first human blow in job’s cascade of loss.

name: Sons of God (heavenly council)
blurb: Heavenly court where angelic beings present themselves; creation and governance are pictured as council work under YHWH’s sovereignty.
searchText: sons of god (heavenly council) group theology heavenly court where angelic beings present themselves; creation and governance are pictured as council work under yhwh’s sovereignty.

name: Bildad the Shuhite
blurb: Traditionalist who leans on ancestral sayings; elevates divine justice but shrinks God’s compassion. His final speech is extremely brief—argument exhausted before truth.
searchText: bildad the shuhite person wisdom traditionalist who leans on ancestral sayings; elevates divine justice but shrinks god’s compassion. his final speech is extremely brief—argument exhausted before truth.

name: Elihu son of Barakel the Buzite, of the family of Ram
blurb: Young, angry, and nuanced—he rebukes both Job and the friends; emphasizes pedagogic suffering and God’s transcendence communicated through creation, dreams, and pain.
searchText: elihu son of barakel the buzite, of the family of ram person wisdom young, angry, and nuanced—he rebukes both job and the friends; emphasizes pedagogic suffering and god’s transcendence communicated through creation, dreams, and pain.

name: Eliphaz the Temanite
blurb: Edomite sage; emphasizes retributive order and mystical insight (‘a word stealthily came to me’). His wisdom is often true but misapplied—he weaponizes proverbs against a sufferer.
searchText: eliphaz the temanite person wisdom edomite sage; emphasizes retributive order and mystical insight (‘a word stealthily came to me’). his wisdom is often true but misapplied—he weaponizes proverbs against a sufferer.

name: Job’s wife
blurb: Suffering partner who voices a terrible counsel—‘curse God and die’—thereby foregrounding Job’s persevering fear of God.
searchText: job’s wife person narrative suffering partner who voices a terrible counsel—‘curse god and die’—thereby foregrounding job’s persevering fear of god.

name: Zophar the Naamathite
blurb: Moral absolutist; impatient with nuance; insists Job’s guilt is less punished than deserved. Zeal without knowledge.
searchText: zophar the naamathite person wisdom moral absolutist; impatient with nuance; insists job’s guilt is less punished than deserved. zeal without knowledge.

name: Atoning sacrifices offered via Job’s priesthood
blurb: Friends bring bulls and rams; Job prays for them—intercession restores community.
searchText: atoning sacrifices offered via job’s priesthood entity worship friends bring bulls and rams; job prays for them—intercession restores community.

name: Behemoth
blurb: Primal strength that only its Maker can approach—symbol of creaturely might; debated identity (hippo? mythic beast?).
searchText: behemoth entity theology primal strength that only its maker can approach—symbol of creaturely might; debated identity (hippo? mythic beast?).

name: Bildad’s first speech & Job’s reply
blurb: Bildad trusts the sayings of fathers; Job longs for a mediator and protests God’s overwhelming might.
searchText: bildad’s first speech & job’s reply entity wisdom bildad trusts the sayings of fathers; job longs for a mediator and protests god’s overwhelming might.

name: Constellations (Pleiades, Orion, Mazzaroth, Bear)
blurb: Stars under leash—astral glory serves the Lord of hosts.
searchText: constellations (pleiades, orion, mazzaroth, bear) entity theology stars under leash—astral glory serves the lord of hosts.

name: Cosmic tour: sea, dawn, storehouses of snow and hail
blurb: Creation as ordered wildness—boundaries for sea and seasons; meteorology as catechesis.
searchText: cosmic tour: sea, dawn, storehouses of snow and hail entity theology creation as ordered wildness—boundaries for sea and seasons; meteorology as catechesis.

name: Elihu’s four speeches
blurb: 1) Human limitation and inspiration; 2) God’s justice beyond our sight; 3) Warning against rebellious talk; 4) Storm theophany prelude—‘God is clothed with awesome majesty.’
searchText: elihu’s four speeches entity wisdom 1) human limitation and inspiration; 2) god’s justice beyond our sight; 3) warning against rebellious talk; 4) storm theophany prelude—‘god is clothed with awesome majesty.’

name: Eliphaz’s first speech & Job’s reply
blurb: Eliphaz argues suffering reveals secret sin; Job counters with honesty about despair and the asymmetry between man and God.
searchText: eliphaz’s first speech & job’s reply entity wisdom eliphaz argues suffering reveals secret sin; job counters with honesty about despair and the asymmetry between man and god.

name: Eliphaz’s second; Bildad’s second; Zophar’s second
blurb: Friends double down on retribution; Job observes the prosperity of the wicked and the pain of the innocent.
searchText: eliphaz’s second; bildad’s second; zophar’s second entity wisdom friends double down on retribution; job observes the prosperity of the wicked and the pain of the innocent.

name: Eliphaz’s third; Bildad’s third; Zophar silent
blurb: Argument thins; pious clichés cannot carry the freight of the ash heap.
searchText: eliphaz’s third; bildad’s third; zophar silent entity wisdom argument thins; pious clichés cannot carry the freight of the ash heap.

name: Family feasting cycle & Job’s priestly intercession
blurb: Sons host rotating banquets; Job rises early to offer burnt offerings ‘perhaps my children have sinned’—intercession anchors festivity.
searchText: family feasting cycle & job’s priestly intercession entity worship sons host rotating banquets; job rises early to offer burnt offerings ‘perhaps my children have sinned’—intercession anchors festivity.

name: Fire of God (lightning)
blurb: Heaven-sent calamity that consumes sheep and servants—mystery of secondary causes under divine leash.
searchText: fire of god (lightning) entity theology heaven-sent calamity that consumes sheep and servants—mystery of secondary causes under divine leash.

name: Great wind from the wilderness
blurb: Windstorm collapses the eldest brother’s house, killing all ten children—creation’s wildness not absent from God’s world.
searchText: great wind from the wilderness entity theology windstorm collapses the eldest brother’s house, killing all ten children—creation’s wildness not absent from god’s world.

name: ‘I know that my Redeemer lives’
blurb: Go’el language (kinsman-redeemer) migrates from land/family law to eschatological hope—vision beyond the skin and the grave.
searchText: ‘i know that my redeemer lives’ entity theology go’el language (kinsman-redeemer) migrates from land/family law to eschatological hope—vision beyond the skin and the grave.

name: Job humbled: hand on mouth
blurb: Silence as wisdom’s gateway—repentance without self-hatred, awe without annihilation.
searchText: job humbled: hand on mouth entity spirituality silence as wisdom’s gateway—repentance without self-hatred, awe without annihilation.

name: Job longs for an umpire/mediator
blurb: Cries for a daysman to lay a hand on both God and man—seed of the mediator hope that later theology will harvest.
searchText: job longs for an umpire/mediator entity theology cries for a daysman to lay a hand on both god and man—seed of the mediator hope that later theology will harvest.

name: Job’s curse of his day
blurb: Lament erupts not against God’s existence but against his own birthday—biblical permission to bring unvarnished pain to God.
searchText: job’s curse of his day entity spirituality lament erupts not against god’s existence but against his own birthday—biblical permission to bring unvarnished pain to god.

name: Job’s final confession (‘I had heard… now my eye sees’)
blurb: Knowledge becomes encounter—dust and ashes name finitude embraced before glory.
searchText: job’s final confession (‘i had heard… now my eye sees’) entity spirituality knowledge becomes encounter—dust and ashes name finitude embraced before glory.

name: Job’s household inventory (initial prosperity)
blurb: Seven sons, three daughters; 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 500 yoke of oxen, 500 female donkeys, and very many servants—greatest of the people of the east.
searchText: job’s household inventory (initial prosperity) entity record seven sons, three daughters; 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 500 yoke of oxen, 500 female donkeys, and very many servants—greatest of the people of the east.

name: Job’s lifespan and legacy
blurb: Lives 140 more years; sees four generations—longevity as a sign of peace, not payment. He dies ‘old and full of days.’
searchText: job’s lifespan and legacy entity record lives 140 more years; sees four generations—longevity as a sign of peace, not payment. he dies ‘old and full of days.’

name: Job’s oath of clearance (integrity code)
blurb: A counter-liturgy of righteousness: covenant with eyes, justice to servants, care for poor, refusal of greed and idolatry—an ethic God later vindicates.
searchText: job’s oath of clearance (integrity code) entity ethics a counter-liturgy of righteousness: covenant with eyes, justice to servants, care for poor, refusal of greed and idolatry—an ethic god later vindicates.

name: Job’s worship in loss (‘YHWH gave…’)
blurb: Tear, shave, fall, worship—doxology through dust. Confession: ‘Blessed be the Name of YHWH.’ No charge of wrong.
searchText: job’s worship in loss (‘yhwh gave…’) entity spirituality tear, shave, fall, worship—doxology through dust. confession: ‘blessed be the name of yhwh.’ no charge of wrong.

name: Land of Uz
blurb: Liminal territory likely east/southeast of Israel (cf. Edom/Aram traditions); wisdom rises from the margins.
searchText: land of uz entity place liminal territory likely east/southeast of israel (cf. edom/aram traditions); wisdom rises from the margins.

name: Mountain goats, deer, wild donkey, wild ox, ostrich
blurb: Untamable creatures witness to God’s delight in freedom and surprise—wisdom refuses reductionism.
searchText: mountain goats, deer, wild donkey, wild ox, ostrich entity theology untamable creatures witness to god’s delight in freedom and surprise—wisdom refuses reductionism.

name: ‘My witness is in heaven’
blurb: From the ash heap Job imagines an advocate—heaven holds a testimony for the wronged.
searchText: ‘my witness is in heaven’ entity theology from the ash heap job imagines an advocate—heaven holds a testimony for the wronged.

name: Restoration double portion (livestock)
blurb: Sheep 14,000; camels 6,000; oxen 1,000 yoke; female donkeys 1,000—God’s generosity answers loss yet does not erase grief.
searchText: restoration double portion (livestock) entity record sheep 14,000; camels 6,000; oxen 1,000 yoke; female donkeys 1,000—god’s generosity answers loss yet does not erase grief.

name: Seven days and nights of silent sitting
blurb: True beginning of comfort—presence without words; the best counsel they will give is before they speak.
searchText: seven days and nights of silent sitting entity spirituality true beginning of comfort—presence without words; the best counsel they will give is before they speak.

name: ‘Skin for skin’ and the boils
blurb: The Accuser claims self-preservation rules the heart; loathsome sores strike Job from foot to crown. He sits among ashes scraping with a potsherd.
searchText: ‘skin for skin’ and the boils entity narrative the accuser claims self-preservation rules the heart; loathsome sores strike job from foot to crown. he sits among ashes scraping with a potsherd.

name: War horse, hawk, eagle
blurb: Power and predation exist under providence—God’s world is not domesticated by our comfort.
searchText: war horse, hawk, eagle entity theology power and predation exist under providence—god’s world is not domesticated by our comfort.

name: Whirlwind theophany
blurb: God answers not with a syllogism but with a storm—questioning that heals vision; awe becomes epistemology.
searchText: whirlwind theophany entity theophany god answers not with a syllogism but with a storm—questioning that heals vision; awe becomes epistemology.

name: Wisdom hymn (‘Where can wisdom be found?’)
blurb: Mining imagery contrasts human ingenuity with wisdom’s hiddenness; ‘the fear of the LORD—that is wisdom.’
searchText: wisdom hymn (‘where can wisdom be found?’) entity wisdom mining imagery contrasts human ingenuity with wisdom’s hiddenness; ‘the fear of the lord—that is wisdom.’

name: YHWH’s verdict on the friends
blurb: God rebukes Eliphaz and his companions: ‘you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has.’ Orthodoxy without empathy misrepresents God.
searchText: yhwh’s verdict on the friends entity theology god rebukes eliphaz and his companions: ‘you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant job has.’ orthodoxy without empathy misrepresents god.

name: Zophar’s first speech & Job’s reply
blurb: Zophar presumes hidden guilt; Job insists on speaking to the Almighty even at risk to himself.
searchText: zophar’s first speech & job’s reply entity wisdom zophar presumes hidden guilt; job insists on speaking to the almighty even at risk to himself.

name: The Satan (the Accuser)
blurb: Court adversary who questions the integrity of piety apart from prosperity—his reach is real but leashed (‘only…’).
